chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm interior lighting with visible neon signs and brick walls.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: light-colored henley shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - animated, gesturing while speaking
Chandler Bing: white t-shirt - blue jeans - short, brown hair - relaxed, leaning back
Rachel Green: red sleeveless top - light-colored pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - listening, occasionally smiling
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, tied-back hair - seated, attentive
Joey Tribbiani: blue t-shirt - grey pants - dark, medium-length hair - seated, arms crossed, listening
Phoebe Buffay: patterned top - dark pants - long, blonde hair - seated, gesturing while speaking

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller is animatedly speaking and gesturing with his hands, addressing the group. Chandler Bing sits back in his chair, relaxed and listening. Rachel Green sits on the couch, holding a coffee mug and smiling. Monica Geller sits beside her, attentive. Joey Tribbiani sits at the bar stool, arms crossed, listening. Phoebe Buffay sits on the couch, gesturing as she speaks. The group is engaged in conversation, with Ross as the primary speaker.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden coffee table (with magazines and mugs)
- Bar stools (with patrons)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Neon "Central Perk" sign (visible)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the absurdity of women's ability to see breasts at any time and men's lack of concern for their actions, with a tone of disbelief and humor. The conversation has a joking tone, with Ross appearing animated and the others reacting with amusement or thoughtful listening.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Scene begins with all characters seated. Ross gestures while speaking. Phoebe gestures while speaking. Joey crosses his arms while listening. Monica remains seated, attentive. Rachel smiles while listening. Chandler leans back, relaxed.
chunk_00001.subtitles: Would you let it go? It's not a big deal. ROSS: Not a big deal? It's amazing. You just reach in, there's one little maneuver, and bam! A bra. Right out the sleeve. As far as I'm concerned... ...there is nothing a guy can do that comes close. Right? Come on! You guys can pee standing up. We can? Okay, I'm trying that. You know what blows my mind? Women can see breasts anytime they want. You just look down, and there they are. How you get any work done is beyond me. What I don't get is the way guys can do so many mean things... ...and then not even care. Multiple orgasms!
chunk_00001.episode: 1x05 - The One With The East German Laundry Detergent

chunk_00002.subtitles: So Saturday night, the big night. Date night! Saturday night. Saturday night! - No plans, huh? - Not a one. Not even, say, breaking up with Janice?

chunk_00003.caption:

Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with visible brick walls and furniture.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**

Chandler Bing: white t-shirt - blue jeans - brown, styled hair - expression: relaxed, gesturing while speaking
Rachel Green: dark-colored top - dark pants - long, wavy brown hair - expression: attentive, listening
Monica Geller: red sleeveless top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression: serious, focused
Joey Tribbiani: light-colored shirt - dark pants - dark, short hair - expression: relaxed, smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross sits on the couch, holding a magazine and speaking animatedly. Chandler sits on a chair, gesturing with his hands as he talks. Rachel sits on the couch, listening and occasionally gesturing. Monica sits in an armchair, holding a pen and notebook, appearing focused. Joey sits nearby, smiling and listening to the conversation.

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses breaking up with Janice with Chandler, who is encouraging him to be strong. The conversation has a casual, supportive tone, with Ross appearing serious and Chandler animated. Monica listens intently, occasionally nodding. Rachel and Joey react with smiles and attentive expressions.

Scene begins with all characters seated. Ross holds a magazine throughout. Chandler gestures while speaking. Monica writes in her notebook. Rachel and Joey remain seated, listening.
chunk_00003.subtitles: Not even, say, breaking up with Janice? Oh, right, right. Shut up. Chandler, nobody likes breaking up with someone. - You just gotta do it. - I know. But it's just so hard. You're sitting with her. She has no idea what's happening. You finally get up the courage to do it. There's that awkward moment when you've handed her the note. Why do you have to break up with her? Be a man. Just stop calling. If you want, I'll do it with you. Thanks, but she'd feel like we were ganging up on her. I mean you break up with Janice. I'll break up with Tony. You're breaking up with Tony? I know. He's sweet, but it's just not fun anymore. I don't know if it's me or his hunger strike. I don't know. Does anybody want anything else? Yeah. Last week you had a wonderful nutty, chocolate-y, kind of cake-y pie thing that...

Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with neon signs visible in background.

Rachel Green: denim sleeveless top - yellow shorts - shoulder-length brown hair - expression animated, engaged in conversation
Chandler Bing: blue t-shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - expression relaxed, occasionally smiling
Monica Geller: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression serious, focused
Joey Tribbiani: white t-shirt with brown vest - blue jeans - short, dark hair - expression animated, gesturing while speaking
Phoebe Buffay: red sleeveless dress - blonde, shoulder-length hair - expression concerned, holding a pen and notepad

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross sits on the couch reading a magazine, then looks up as the group gathers. Rachel stands and gestures while speaking to the group. Chandler sits on the couch holding a mug, listening and occasionally responding. Monica sits in a chair, holding a pen and notepad, appearing focused. Joey sits on a stool, animatedly talking and gesturing. Phoebe enters from the side, holding a notepad and pen, and joins the conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**

- Wooden table (with mugs and papers)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses his father wanting to give him a Mercedes convertible with the group. The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone, with Ross appearing surprised and Rachel animatedly reacting. Monica listens intently, while Chandler and Joey engage in the discussion with expressive gestures.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Phoebe enters the frame from the right side.
Rachel stands up from the couch to speak.
Joey gestures with his hands while talking.
Monica shifts her position slightly while holding her notepad.
chunk_00004.subtitles: Nothing. I'm fine. What's the matter? Why so scrunchie? It's my father. He wants to give me a Mercedes convertible. That guy, he burns me up. Yeah, well, it's a Mercedes if I move back home. It was horrible! He called me "young lady." Ooh, I hate when my father calls me that. Did he give you that whole "You're not up to this" thing again? Yeah, I got the extended disco version with three choruses of: "You'll never make it on your own." [SINGS] Uh-huh, uh-huh Hi, Joey. Oh, my God. Angela. Wow. Being dumped by you obviously agrees with her. - Are you gonna go over there? - No. Yeah. No. Okay, but not yet. I don't wanna seem too eager. One Mississippi, two Mississippi...
chunk_00004.episode: 1x05 - The One With The East German Laundry Detergent

chunk_00005.subtitles: ...three Mississippi. That seems pretty cool. Hey, Angela. Joey. You look good. Because I'm wearing a dress that accents my boobs. You don't say. So, Rachel, what are you doing tonight? Big glamour night. Me and Monica at Launderama. Oh. You wanna hear a freakish coincidence? Guess who's doing laundry there too? - Who? - Me. Was that not clear? Hey, why don't...? Why don't I just join you both there? Don't you have a laundry room in your building? Yes. I do have a laundry room in my building.

chunk_00006.subtitles: I do have a laundry room in my building. Um... But there's a rat problem. Apparently, they're attracted to the dryer sheets. They're going in fine, but they're coming out all... ...fluffy. Anyway, 7-ish? Sure. Forget it, Joey. I'm with Bob now. Bob? Who the hell's Bob? Bob is great. He's smart, he's sophisticated, and he has a real job. You go on three auditions a month and you call yourself an actor. But Bob... Come on. We were great together. And not just at the fun stuff, but, like, talking too. Sorry, Joey. You said, "Let's just be friends." So guess what? - What? - We're just friends. Fine. Fine. So why don't the four of us go out and have dinner tonight? You know, as friends.
chunk_00006.episode: 1x05 - The One With The East German Laundry Detergent

chunk_00007.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm artificial lighting with natural light visible through large windows.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: red sleeveless top - blue jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated, expressive
Chandler Bing: blue t-shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - serious, concerned

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica and Chandler are having an intense conversation in Monica’s apartment. Monica gestures emphatically while speaking, holding a jacket, and moves around the room, at one point looking out a window. Chandler stands facing her, listening intently, then sits down on the couch as the conversation continues. Monica sits beside him, continuing to speak and gesture.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Refrigerator: white, with magnets and photos on door
- Flower arrangement: purple and orange lilies in a white vase
- Couch: white with red-and-white checkered blanket
- TV: black, behind Monica and Chandler
- Poster: "Jouets et Objets d'Art" visible on wall
- Window: large, multi-paned, showing city view

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Chandler discusses asking Monica to help him with a favor involving a man named Bob, who is Angela’s brother, with Monica. The conversation has a serious, pleading tone, with Chandler appearing concerned and Monica reacting with animated expressions and gestures, suggesting she is skeptical or hesitant. The dialogue implies Chandler is trying to convince Monica to help him win back Angela.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Monica moves from standing near the refrigerator to walking toward the window, then to the couch.
Chandler moves from standing to sitting on the couch.
Monica sits down beside Chandler on the couch.
chunk_00007.subtitles: So why don't the four of us go out and have dinner tonight? You know, as friends. What "four of us"? You and Bob, and me and my girlfriend, um... ...Monica. JOEY: Monica, I'm telling you, this guy is perfect for you. Forget it! Not after your cousin who could belch the alphabet. Come on, this guy's great. His name's Bob. He's Angela's... ...ahem, brother. He's smart, he's sophisticated... ...and he has a real job. Me, I go on three auditions a month and call myself an actor, but Bob is... - Oh, God, help us. - What? Ugly Naked Guy is laying kitchen tile. BOTH: Ew! Look, I'm asking a favor here. I'm thinking if I do this for her brother... ...maybe Angela will come back to me. What's going on here? You go out with tons of girls. I know, but... Look, I made a huge mistake. I never should've broke up with her. Will you help me? Please?
chunk_00007.episode: 1x05 - The One With The East German Laundry Detergent

chunk_00008.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Ross Geller's bedroom — nighttime, artificial indoor lighting

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: light-colored button-up shirt over dark t-shirt - dark pants - dark, short hair - concerned/animated expression
Chandler Bing: dark-colored polo shirt with white stripe - blue jeans - dark, medium-length hair - concerned/animated expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller stands holding a laundry basket while talking animatedly to Chandler Bing, who stands with hands on hips, reacting with concern and gesturing back. Ross gestures with his free hand as he speaks, appearing to explain something important, while Chandler responds with expressive hand movements and facial reactions. Ross then picks up a piece of clothing from the basket, continuing the conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Laundry basket: blue plastic (on bed)
- Bed: purple and orange striped sheets (left side)
- Chair: beige armchair (center)
- Dresser: wooden with dinosaur figurines (right side)
- Poster: framed, with Cyrillic text "ФИЗИКА" (Physics) (on wall)
- Guitar: mounted on wall (left side)
- Lamp: black lampshade (on nightstand)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses laundry with Chandler Bing, specifically about the state of his underwear and fabric softener for an upcoming date with Rachel Green. The conversation has a jokingly tense tone, with Ross appearing anxious and Chandler reacting with exaggerated concern and gestures.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross Geller picks up a piece of clothing from the laundry basket at 0:41. Chandler Bing gestures with both hands while speaking at 0:24. Ross Geller gestures with his right hand while speaking at 0:47.
chunk_00008.subtitles: Okay. Bye. Monica's not coming. It's just gonna be me and Rachel. [ROSS CHUCKLES] Hold on there, camper. You sure you've thought this through? It's laundry. The thinking through is pretty minimal. It's just you and Rachel? Just the two of you? This is a date. You're going on a date. Nuh-uh. Yeah-huh. What are you saying? I should shave again? Pick up some wine? What? Well, you may wanna rethink the dirty underwear. It's the first time she'll see your underwear. You want it to be dirty? No. And the fabric softener? Okay, okay. Now, what is wrong with my Snuggles?
chunk_00008.episode: 1x05 - The One With The East German Laundry Detergent

chunk_00009.subtitles: What? It says I'm a sensitive, warm kind of guy. You know, like a little fuzzy bear. I can pick something else up on the way. MONICA: Thank you. So what does this Bob guy look like? Is he tall, short? Yep. Which? Which what? You've never met Bob, have you? No, but... For all we know, he could be horribly... Horribly attractive. I'll be shutting up now. Where are they? Where are they? This is nice. We never do anything, just the two of us. That's great. Maybe tomorrow we can rent a car, run over some puppies. Ew. I don't wanna do that. - Here we go. - Have a good breakup.

chunk_00010.subtitles: - Here we go. - Have a good breakup. - Hey, Janice. - My God, I am so glad you called me. I had the most supremely awful day. That's not good. Can I get an espresso and a latte over here, please? We got the proofs from that photo shoot with the vegetables. They sucked. I blew off the rest of the afternoon. I went shopping. And I got you... JANICE: I'm looking. I'm looking. I'm looking. - I got you... - What? - What? - What did you get me there? I got you... ...these. Bullwinkle socks. - That's so sweet. - I knew you had the Rockys. So you could wear Bullwinkle and Bullwinkle... ...or wear Rocky and Rocky, or you can mix and match. Moose and squirrel. Whatever you want.

chunk_00012.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Laundromat — daytime, fluorescent lighting
White washing machines line the room, with a soda vending machine and soap dispensers visible in the background.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: plaid sleeveless shirt - dark pants - brown hair in a bun - expression shifts from concerned to amused
Ross Geller: light pink button-up shirt over blue t-shirt - dark pants - dark hair - expression shifts from confused to animated
Unidentified person: light yellow t-shirt with graphic - colorful patterned hat - dark hair - expression animated, talking
Unidentified person: light-colored sleeveless shirt - dark pants - dark hair - expression neutral
Unidentified person: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - dark hair - expression neutral

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel stands at a washing machine, holding a white laundry basket, talking to the person in the colorful hat. Ross approaches, gesturing and talking animatedly to the person in the hat, who responds with exaggerated expressions. Rachel watches them interact, her expression changing from concern to amusement. The person in the hat gestures toward the machines and the basket, appearing to explain something. Ross then turns to Rachel, smiling as he interacts with her.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- White laundry basket (in Rachel’s hands)
- White washing machines (multiple, in a row)
- Soda vending machine (red and white, with "refreshing soft drinks" sign)
- Soap dispensers (white cabinet with "SOAP BLEACH SOFTENERS" sign)
- Fire extinguisher (on wall)
- Red and blue detergent bottles (on top of vending machine)
- Wicker basket (on floor, near machines)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses the lack of suds in the laundry machine with the person in the colorful hat, who responds with animated gestures. Rachel observes the interaction, her expression shifting from concern to amusement. The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone, with Ross appearing animated and the person in the hat appearing emphatic. Rachel reacts by smiling and engaging with Ross.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross moves from standing behind Rachel to stepping forward and gesturing toward the washing machine.
Rachel shifts her position slightly, turning to face Ross as he speaks.
The person in the colorful hat gestures toward the machines and the basket, then turns to face Ross.
chunk_00012.subtitles: It's really pretty. Unfortunately, I don't see suds! What? No suds, no save, okay? - What's going on? - Hi. Nothing. This horrible woman just took my machine. Was your basket on top? - Yeah, but there were no suds. - So? You know, no suds, no save. No suds, no... Excuse me. Hold on a second! This is my friend's machine. Hey, hey, hey! Her stuff wasn't in it! Hey, hey, hey! That's not the rule, and you know it! All right. Show's over. Nothing to see here. Okay. Let's do laundry. That was amazing! I can't even send back soup.
chunk_00012.episode: 1x05 - The One With The East German Laundry Detergent

chunk_00013.subtitles: That was amazing! I can't even send back soup. Well, that's because you're such a sweet, gentle... Do you, uh? Oh, hey. You must need detergent. - What's that? - Überweiss. It's new. It's German. It's extra tough! Rach, do you...? Are you gonna separate those? Oh, God. Ugh. Am I being like a total laundry spaz? Am I supposed to use one machine for shirts and another for pants? Have you...? Have you never done this before? Well, not myself. But I know other people that have. Okay. You caught me. I'm a laundry virgin. Don't worry. I'll use the gentle cycle. [BOTH CHUCKLE] Okay...

chunk_00014.subtitles: Okay... Basically, you wanna use one machine for all your whites. Whites. Okay. - A whole other machine for your colors. - Colors. And then a third for your, uh... ...delicates. And that would be your bras... ...and your underpanty things. Okay, well, these are white cotton panties. Would they go with whites or with delicates? That would be a judgment call. [ALL LAUGHING] He's so cute! So where did you guys grow up? - Brooklyn Heights. - Cleveland. Ha. Heh, heh, heh. - How did that happen? - Oh, my God! What? I suddenly had the feeling I was... ...falling. But I'm not.

She's too much for me in bed. Sexually. I've gotta tell you, Bob is terrific. Yeah, isn't he? It's so great to meet a guy who's smart and funny... ...and has an emotional age beyond 8. RACHEL: Okay, I know this is gonna sound really stupid... ...but I feel that if I can do this... ...if I can actually do my own laundry... ...there isn't anything I can't do. That does not sound stupid to me. No, it's like... The first time I had to make dinner for myself after Carol left me... [WASHER BUZZES] I'm sorry, that's all the time we have. Next on Ross... [RACHEL LAUGHS] Okay. - Uh-oh. - What, "uh-oh"? Uh-oh... Uh-oh, the laundry's done. It's a song. The laundry song that we sing. [SINGS] Uh-oh, the laundry's done What's the matter? Nothing. Nothing. [SINGS] The laundry's done Come on, show me. It's just that you left a red sock in with your whites, and now...

chunk_00018.subtitles: It's just that you left a red sock in with your whites, and now... ...everything's kind of pink. - Oh. Everything's pink? Except for the red sock, which is still red. Don't be upset. It can happen to anyone. But it didn't. It happened to me. God, I'm gonna look like a big Marshmallow Peep! What am I doing? What am I doing? My father's right! I can't live on my own. I can't even do laundry! [WOMAN LAUGHS] [NIBBLING] Something went wrong with Underdog... ...and they couldn't get his head to inflate. So anyway... ...his head is, like, flopping down Broadway. And I'm thinking... ...how inappropriate this is. I've got something's in my eye. Joey, could we check it in the light, please?

chunk_00019.subtitles: I've got something's in my eye. Joey, could we check it in the light, please? - Oh, my God! - What? Hello! Were we at the same table? It's like... ...cocktails in Appalachia. - Come on, they're close. - Close? She's got her tongue in his ear. Like you've never got a little rambunctious with Ross. Joey, this is sick. It's disgusting. It's... ...not really true, is it? Who's to say what's true? What were you thinking? Look, I'm not proud of this, okay? Well, maybe I am a little. - Oh. - Ow! - I'm out of here! - Wait! Come on! You like him. I want her. He likes you. - Really? - Yeah. I'm thinking, if we put our heads together, between the two of us... ...we can break them up.

I'll be right back. I hit her in the eye! I hit her in the eye! This is the worst breakup in the history of the world! Oh, my God. How many of those have you had? I don't know. A million! chunk_00022.subtitles: I had a 24-inch waist. You lose things. Now, come on. Get out of my way. I'm sorry. Maybe I wasn't being clear. This was our cart. Hey, hey, hey. There aren't any clothes in it! Hey, hey, hey! Quit making up rules! Let go! Come on, this is my cart. You know I saw it first. Listen, Mitzi, if you want this cart... ...you're gonna have to take me with it! Yes! Did you see that? You were incredible. A brand-new woman, ladies and gentlemen. I could not have done this without you. ROSS: Okay, um... Uh... More clothes in the dryer? - I'm fine. I'm fine. - Are you sure? - Are you sure you're okay? - Yeah. - Does it still hurt? - Yeah.
